fields.headline: Weinstock mourned
fields.bodyText: Lord Weinstock, one of the most successful racehorse owners of the post-War years, died yesterday. He was 81. Weinstock's colours are due to be carried by Golan, last year's 2,000 Guineas winner, in the King George VI and Queen Elizabeth Diamond Stakes at Ascot on Saturday. Other famous horses to carry his colours included Troy, the 1979 Derby winner, the 1983 Oaks winner Sun Princess, and Pilsudski, who won the Eclipse Stakes and the Japan Cup. Lord Weinstock owned horses for half a century and bred many of his own winners. He was also the owner of the 300-acre Ballymacoll Stud in Ireland. Weinstock's death comes a day after the turf lost another leading owner, Ahmed Salman, whose horses included War Emblem, who won the Kentucky Derby in May, and the 1999 Derby winner, Oath.
